text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6a950581da52b410a74531044aae8f1f8f38a7df|patch 8.2.1533: Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg()>
patch 8.2.1533: Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg()

Problem:    Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg().
Solution:   Use dict_get_bool() for "isunnamed". (closes #6784)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1533: Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg() · vim/vim@6a95058
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1533: Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg() · vim/vim@6a95058
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error when passing getreginfo() result to setreg(). Solution: Use dict_get_bool() for "isunnamed". (closes #6784)

text:

patch 8.2.1532: compiler warning for conversion of size_t to long

Problem:    Compiler warning for conversion of size_t to long.
Solution:   Add type cast.

patch 8.2.1531: Vim9: test still fails on MS-Windows

Problem:    Vim9: test still fails on MS-Windows.
Solution:   When skipping expect function to be NULL.

text:

patch 8.2.1530: Vim9: test fails on MS-Windows

Problem:    Vim9: test fails on MS-Windows.
Solution:   Skip Ex command inside "if false".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1530: Vim9: test fails on MS-Windows · vim/vim@5163fcc
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1530: Vim9: test fails on MS-Windows · vim/vim@5163fcc
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: test fails on MS-Windows. Solution: Skip Ex command inside "if false".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/749639ec7248740cd271f34ec5f7bb70891b459c|patch 8.2.1529: Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed>
patch 8.2.1529: Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed

Problem:    Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed.
Solution:   Do evaluate the :elseif expression.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1529: Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed · vim/vim@749639e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1529: Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed · vim/vim@749639e
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: :elseif may be compiled when not needed. Solution: Do evaluate the :elseif expression.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3988f64f9d512fd809d4a600b020638bf2c7d7ec|patch 8.2.1528: Vim9: :endif not found after "if false">
patch 8.2.1528: Vim9: :endif not found after "if false"

Problem:    Vim9: :endif not found after "if false".
Solution:   When skipping still check for a following command. (closes #6797)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1528: Vim9: :endif not found after "if false" · vim/vim@3988f64
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1528: Vim9: :endif not found after "if false" · vim/vim@3988f64
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: :endif not found after "if false". Solution: When skipping still check for a following command. (closes #6797)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/601e76ac3c8fa5d65ac04647a762792ea343ebd5|patch 8.2.1527: Vim9: cannot use a function name at script level>
patch 8.2.1527: Vim9: cannot use a function name at script level

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use a function name as a function reference at script
            level.
Solution:   Check if a name is a function name. (closes #6789)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1527: Vim9: cannot use a function name at script level · vim/vim@601e76a
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1527: Vim9: cannot use a function name at script level · vim/vim@601e76a
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use a function name as a function reference at script level. Solution: Check if a name is a function name. (closes #6789)
